intro: Thesium divaricatum var. expansum, commonly known as the broad-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features linear to lanceolate leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a spike-like inflorescence. It is characterized by its distinctive branching pattern and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Thesium divaricatum var. expansum is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
